Clearwater, Florida: Fun Things to Do Skip to content Home Food Menu Drink Menu Live Music Order Now Specials Book Event Contact Us Join Our Team Blog Home Food Menu Drink Menu Live Music Order Now Specials Book Event Contact Us Join Our Team Blog Welcome to Clearwater, Florida : The Land of Fun and Food Badfins Restaurant Clearwater Beach ¬ª Welcome to Clearwater, Florida : The Land of Fun and Food SHARE Prev Badfins Wins The Tripadvisor 2021 Travelers‚Äô Choice Award Badfins ‚Äì The Best Beachfront Bar in Clearwater Beach Next Introduction Florida is the place to be for fun-filled days and endless adventure, especially when you are at Clearwater Beach. Situated just a short distance from Tampa, Clearwater Beach is the ultimate destination for lip-smacking food, incredible drinks, and relaxation. Where is Clearwater Beach, Florida? Clearwater Beach is about 25 miles west of Tampa on the Gulf Coast. You may choose to fly into Clearwater. Two of the closest airports available are the St. Petersburg-Clearwater International Airport and Tampa International Airport. Depending on the traffic, Clearwater is about 35 to 45 minutes away from Tampa by road. Beachside Activities in Clearwater Beach, Florida As the name suggests, Clearwater Beach allows you to experience the beauty of nature in its truest form. This beach, with its soft, white sand, attracts visitors from all over the world. People engage themselves in tons of activities to suit their taste, whether that is sunbathing or water sports at the beachfront promenade. Some of our visitors‚Äô favorite activities are, Parasailing Jet-skiing Stand-up paddleboarding Rollerblading Cycling Surfing Wave running Scuba diving Snorkeling Swimming Sailing Once you are done, you can beat the heat and have a bite at Clearwater Beach restaurants and cafes that are designed to impress. As the sun sets in the evening, you may see night-time festivals with craft vendors and street performers adding excitement to your day. With great food, drinks, and activities, you can make this vacation an experience of a lifetime at this beautiful holiday destination. If you‚Äôre looking for the best Clearwater Beach restaurant, Badfins Food + Brew provides some fantastic dining experiences to make your taste buds tingle. Alternatively, you may just choose to organize your party near the sea by booking our banquet hall. With Badfins, you‚Äôre guaranteed to experience endless excitement! What to Expect in Clearwater Beach Like its namesake, the water at Clearwater Beach is extremely clear, and the white sand is so soft that it feels like a luxurious carpet when you walk on it. You will find plenty of space at the beach to enjoy and relax under the sun. You can start your day at any of the Clearwater Beach breakfast restaurants and end your evening with a walk down the beach. Aside from adventure, there are plenty of romantic things to do in Clearwater Beach , and you may bring your partner for a cozy weekend here. Where to Stay in Clearwater Beach There are plenty of hotels, resorts, and lodges available near the beach. Most of these hotels and resorts are situated right on the beach, so you do not have to worry about traveling. The restaurants vary in their prices to suit your budget, but they all offer basic amenities, guarantee hygiene, and are conveniently located. Where to Eat in Clearwater Beach Food is an area in which you can‚Äôt compromise. A good vacation is nothing without delicious food and drinks. You can always check out Badfins Food + Brew. Our comprehensive menu guarantees to blow your mind and treat your taste buds. Besides, Clearwater Beach restaurants offer the freshest seafood and craft beer. Most of them line the beach, so you are not forced to spend time away from the sea. Clearwater Beach breakfast restaurants allow you to start your day with your favorite seafood overlooking the gorgeous sea and sparkling white sand. Adventure and Romance in Clearwater Beach, Florida Adventure and romance are in the air at Clearwater! Here‚Äôs a list of romantic things to do in Clearwater Beach. Visit the Clearwater Marine Aquarium with your partner and explore marine life. Go for a 90-minute sea safari, getting a first-hand look at the aquatic life and experiencing the famous dolphins from close quarters. There are more than a hundred dolphin sculptures around Clearwater Beach. You can see the creativity of the artists on these dolphin sculptures as you stroll through the area with your partner. Pier 60, which ends at Clearwater Beach, is a tourist hub. You can find eateries, playgrounds, souvenir shops, and much more on Pier 60. A daily event called ‚ÄúSunsets at Pier 60‚Äù includes street performers and musical acts. You can enjoy the beautiful sunset at the beach with your partner. Transportation in Clearwater Beach Transportation in Clearwater Beach is hassle-free and convenient. It is advisable not to bring your vehicle as you will have to worry about parking spaces every time you make a move. Instead, choose local transport options. One of the most affordable options is the Jolly Trolley that makes multiple stops along Clearwater Beach. Florida Free Rides runs every day from 9 am to 3 pm, operating only on sponsors and tips. Conclusion There are only a few places in the world where you can experience true natural beauty combined with modern amenities and incredible food and activities. Clearwater Beach is certainly one of them. It has amazing places to dine, drink, and dance while overlooking one of the best beaches in the US. Clearwater Beach is a paradise for people looking to take a break at one of the best marine destinations in the country. What adds to the experience is the lip-smacking food. Whenever your taste buds need an adventure of their own, you can always visit Badfins to order from our amazing menu and dine and drink in a great ambiance. We can‚Äôt wait for you to visit us! Founders' one-page summary of portfolio and investment criteria. THE FOUNDERS STORY FULL VIDEO HOME About Us About Founders ‚Äã FAMILY-OWNED COMPANY INVESTING ITS OWN CAPITAL Founders is a family-owned company that invests its own capital and applies operating know-how to build a group of thriving food businesses and exceptional partnerships we can all be proud of. ‚Äã LONG HISTORY & AFFILIATIONS Founders is backed by Tricor Pacific Capital (Rod Senft & Senft family), Saville House Holdings (Richard Harris & Harris family) and Garibaldi Blue (Derek Senft). Our partners combine deep operating knowledge with over 30 years‚Äô experience making control investments in over 80 private companies . We have a track record of transacting with speed and price certainty as a group of highly experienced partners investing our own capital. ‚Äã BUILDING A FAMILY OF THRIVING FOOD BUSINESSES AND EXCEPTIONAL PARTNERSHIPS In 2014, we set out to build a family of related food businesses in mature categories to grow over the very long term. Since 2020, Founders is focused on its existing portfolio, including acquisition of closely-related protein platforms and add-on M&A to Armand Agra, its US protein processing and distribution business, as well as new protein platforms. In 2021, we completed a substantial add-on to Armand Agra and a new platform acquisition, Walt's Meats. ‚Äã ‚Äã TRICOR & SAVILLE STORYBOARDS Download the storyboard for the Senft family's Tricor Pacific Capital and the Harris family's Saville House Holdings to get a snapshot of where Founders and its shareholders are active. COMPANY HISTORY Download Founders' timeline for a snapshot overview of who we are and to see how our group of companies has evolved over time. THE SWALLOW Learn more about the Swallow . Meet the Founders MEET THE FOUNDERS FULL VIDEO Read More On Working With Us Investment Criteria Investment Scope ‚Äã ‚Äã ‚Äã Primarily focused on investments in food processors and distributors; also invest in related real estate. Primary focus on businesses with $5 to $10M of EBITDA (USD or CAD); stretching to $10 to $25M of EBITDA (USD or CAD) for exceptional opportunities ; no size limitation for add-on acquisitions to existing businesses. Geographic focus in Midwest, Southwest or West of USA and Central / Western Canada, extending to East within priority segments (e.g., protein ). Preference for mature and durable businesses that are cash-flow generative, and include hard assets. Look for opportunity to invest, grow and hold a business over very long term while offering liquidity for minority shareholders and management along the way; opportunity to contribute operating know-how to create value; opportunity for the business platform to create a bigger future; opportunity to create a mutual benefit among the different businesses in the Founders Group of Food Companies. "Founders is a family-owned company that invests its own capital and applies operating know-how to build a group of thriving food businesses and exceptional partnerships we can all be proud of." Read More On Transaction Process Read More On Differentiation Our Businesses Our Businesses Statement complying with the Canadian Fighting Against Forced Labour and Child Labour in Supply Chains Act New Business Platforms Founders is actively seeking to add new food processors or distributors. Click here to see our Investment Scope . Industriousness and humility. Resilience and experience. Renewal, safe return, good luck and happiness. Read More On Case Studies Working With Us Working With Us ‚Äã ‚Äã PARTNERSHIP ALIGNMENT We ensure alignment of interests and financial¬†goals across all stakeholders, including transparent ownership rights and structures. ‚Äã REFINE STRATEGY & BUILD ORGANIZATION CAPABILITY We partner with companies in creating a strategic road-map with a focus on value creation through building organization capability (leadership & culture, people & skills, knowledge & systems, tools and processes, metrics) and improvements in market and customer relevance. ‚Äã ‚Äã LEADERSHIP SUPPORT Founders' senior team balance operating know-how with transaction and financing skills.¬† We engage as an active Chairman and Board , creating freedom within a framework for companies in our group. ‚Äã ‚Äã VALUES-DRIVEN MINDSET We have a values-driven mindset and culture. Our core mindsets and behaviors¬†include:¬†'Love of Food', 'Always Improving', 'Be Ambitious', 'Freedom within a Framework', 'Stakeholder-oriented', 'People Matter',¬†'Build Organization Capability' and 'Winning with Customers & Consumers'. ‚Äã ‚Äã INVEST, BUILD, AND HOLD We are business builders (vs. investors), with an explicit intention to own our group of companies¬†indefinitely. ‚Äã ‚Äã "We imagine a decentralized but integrated group of food and beverage companies, each with the vision and ambition to be more tomorrow than they are today, where teams are continuously focused on winning in the marketplace, developing the strength and scalability of themselves and their businesses, creating working lives that are more rewarding for all, and making a positive impact on society.‚Äù Read More On Testimonials Team Founders Team Richard Harris Managing Partner Derek Senft Managing Partner Rod Senft Partner Trevor Johnstone Partner Faye Evangelista VP Finance Ailsa Harris Business Development Director Christian Maas Managing Director Zak Nash VP Corporate Development Alex Komarov Senior Accountant Arsh Malhi Treasury Manager Founders Group of Food Companies Inc. Advertise with Forbes Forbes Licensing & Syndication Report a Security Issue Editorial Values and Standards Site Feedback Contact Us Careers at Forbes Tips Corrections Privacy Do Not Sell My Personal Information Terms AdChoices Reprints & Permissions Leadership ForbesWomen 7 Entrepreneurs Shaking Up The Food Industry By MeiMei Fox , Former Contributor. Forbes contributors publish independent expert analyses and insights. MeiMei Fox writes about aligning your career with your life purpose. Jun 07, 2019, 08:04am EDT Share Save This article is more than 6 years old. More than $1 billion was invested in food industry startups in 2016. This is hardly surprising when you realize that food sales in the U.S. total over $2 trillion . Within this immense category, consumers are increasingly interested in healthy foods that are local, organic, and minimally processed, companies that have a social and/or environmental mission, and any unique, specialty items. Capitalizing on these trends, here are 7 entrepreneurs who are shaking and spicing things up in the world of food. Jordan Karcher is the founder and CEO of Grounds and Hounds Coffee. Grounds and Hounds Jordan Karcher, founder and CEO of Grounds & Hounds Coffee Jordan Karcher is the 32-year-old founder and CEO of Grounds & Hounds Coffee, a company that believes great coffee can fuel an even greater purpose. Through the sale of their organic and fair-trade specialty coffees, they support dog rescue initiatives and organizations, dedicating 20% of all profits to making their ‚Äúsecond-chance for pups‚Äù mission a reality. Karcher has had a passion for helping animals for as long as he can remember. As a child, he aspired to become a veterinarian. Then, while attending business school in 2013, he saw the value of building a business in the social impact space. ‚ÄúI decided that I would like my efforts at work to address issues that connect with me personally,‚Äù he says. Raising capital for a socially-conscious business has proved challenging, however. When Karcher first began meeting with potential funders, he learned that most institutional investors have a narrow interest in social impact due to the traditional emphasis on maximizing return. So he bootstrapped and refocused Grounds & Hounds to emphasize positive cash flow through e-commerce in order to fund growth, which attracted private equity in 2018. This strategy worked. The company currently is celebrating its fifth anniversary, having grown revenue by 300%. To aspiring entrepreneurs, Karcher offers this advice. ‚Äú While it is important to always follow your passion, remember that your product and the customer experience must meet or exceed that of industry competitors. People love to purchase brands they connect with emotionally and align with socially, but they will return to your competitors if the product and experience don't match their category expectations. Exist to do good, but compete as if your product and experience are all that matter.‚Äù Leah Goldglantz is the founder of Leah's Plate. Leah's Plate Leah Goldglantz, founder of Leah‚Äôs Plate Leah Goldglantz is the 32-year-old founder of Leah‚Äôs Plate, a health and wellness blog. Her goal is to inspire people to live a healthier lifestyle by educating them on which products are truly healthy, as well as providing recipes made using clean ingredients. Since we‚Äôre all short on time, Leah‚Äôs Plate recipes require minimal healthy ingredients and are quick and easy to make. Goldglantz offers baby and toddler recipes since she has two little ones at home, and also sometimes recommends non-toxic health, beauty, and home products. The first year she started Leah‚Äôs Plate, Goldglantz was happy simply to receive free products in exchange for coverage on her blog and Instagram. By the second year, she was thrilled to have a handful of sponsored posts and to be making a little money doing something she is passionate about. By the third year, Leah's Plate had gained over 100,000 followers on Instagram and was averaging $10,000 per month in revenue from brand partnerships and affiliate marketing. And it‚Äôs still growing. Before starting Leah's Plate, Goldglantz was at a low point in life. She wasn't eating well and her main focus was going to nightclubs. She made a commitment to make a big lifestyle change. Not believing in fad diets, she chose to nourish her body with wholesome foods. ‚ÄúAlmost immediately, I felt lighter and my brain fog cleared,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúI was more active and sleeping better than ever.‚Äù Now, her goal is to help others feel as good as she does. ‚ÄúIf you do what you love, you'll never work a day in your life,‚Äù Goldglantz says to aspiring entrepreneurs. ‚ÄúIt takes a ton of hard work and time to build a company, but never give up and always be genuine and authentic. Stay true to yourself and your goals. Don't try to cut corners or take shortcuts, because it never works to your advantage.‚Äù Daniel Zakowski is the founder and CEO of Ready, Set, Food! Ready Set Food Daniel Zakowski , founder and CEO of Ready, Set, Food! While food allergies are a significant and growing problem, research indicates that up to¬† 80% of them can be prevented through the early and frequent introduction of allergenic foods to infants. That means that just by following the new American Association of Pediatrics guidelines for early allergen introduction, we can help prevent approximately 200,000 infants every year from developing life-threatening food allergies. Ready, Set, Food! was designed to make this process easy and affordable by providing parents with a pre-measured, all-natural supplement that dissolves easily in breastmilk, formula, or food. Using the same process proven effective in three clinical trials, it gradually exposes infants to peanuts, egg, and milk ‚Äì the foods that cause 80% of all allergies. Over 300 pediatricians and allergists promote the product in their practice. Ready, Set, Food! founder and CEO Daniel Zakowski was inspired to find an effective way to help kids when his nephew Abe began suffering from¬†severe allergies to peanuts, eggs, and milk at the age of seven months. Last year, Abe accidentally ate a bite of pizza and found himself struggling to breathe. He had to have a dose of EpiPen. Because any activity that involves food could be a danger to him, Abe has to be watched at all times. When he realized that Abe‚Äôs food allergies could likely have been prevented, Zakowski knew he had to act. This is the second company Zakowski has founded. His first company sold consumable products, including latex gloves, to dentists. Although it reached a peak revenue of $10M, it went out of business in the aftermath of the 2008 recession.¬†‚ÄúIt was a difficult time,‚Äù Zakowski says. ‚ÄúI dealt with it in the short term by focusing on family, my new marriage, and community service in the political realm.‚Äù¬†But when he discovered the opportunity to build a great business and also help prevent 80% of childhood food allergies, Zakowski felt compelled to dive in and overcome his prior ‚Äúfailure.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe all have a difference we can make in the world, whether or not our job is the primary way we make that difference,‚Äù Zakowski says. ‚ÄúThis is an important message because many people need to work to make ends meet and don't have the luxury of choosing a career that helps people. So remember, there are many ways we can and must help others.‚Äù Howard and Dana Bloom are the cofounders of Proper Food. Proper Food Dana and Howard Bloom, cofounders of Proper Food Dana and Howard Bloom are the cofounders of Proper Food, a high-quality grab-and-go food company launched in 2013, which currently has 12 locations between San Francisco and NYC. Proper Food aims to eliminate the¬†dilemma between eating well and eating fast. All items are prepared from scratch each morning by a team led by Chef Munoz, who hails from a Michelin-starred¬†kitchen. The food consists of locally-sourced ingredients such as wild fresh octopus,¬†kale, steaks, burritos, fresh juices, and more. The husband and wife team are passionate about food and even more passionate about people. They were driven to create Proper Food to fill a need. ‚ÄúWhile working in downtown San Francisco, we found ourselves either waiting in line a half-hour for lunch or getting something unhealthy and unsatisfying.‚Äù But they also were driven by a greater life purpose, which is to have a positive impact on the lives of others. Proper Food not only makes high-quality food more accessible, but also ensures carefully sourced ingredients, treats its team well, and gives back to its communities.¬†To date, the company has donated over 300,000 unsold meals to help feed the hungry. The biggest hardship they have faced together was the loss of Howard‚Äôs father, Michael Bloom, in 2009, just six months before the couple‚Äôs son was born. ‚ÄúMichael has been a major inspiration for the Proper Food philosophy. He was growing his own vegetables and cooking local, seasonal and organic before those were buzz words,‚Äù the Blooms say. The founders have this advice for people struggling to figure out their life purpose. ‚ÄúIt takes focus and intention to listen to your heart and figure out what makes you thrive. Once you‚Äôve figured out that part, it‚Äôs simply having the courage to take. The more you align your career with your purpose, the more energized you will feel and you‚Äôll be amazed at how things just start to fall into place.‚Äù Steven J. Singer is the founder and CEO of Fody Food Co. Fody Food Co. Steven J. Singer, founder and CEO of Fody Food Co. In 1999, while in his 20s, Steven J. Singer founded Glutino, a company that made gluten-free food before the gluten-free movement went mainstream. He helped to grow the company from a startup to sales exceeding $50 million.¬†Through this work, he saw the transformational outcomes the products had for people with Celiac disease. This led Singer to found Fody, the leading low FODMAP food company, which sells snacks, sauces, salsas, oils and seasonings. Consuming low FODMAP foods helps the 45 million Americans suffering from IBS to enjoy eating again. Since launching in 2016, Fody has brought the low FODMAP diet to the U.S. and been picked up by Whole Foods, Sprouts, Wegmans, and more retailers nationwide. Helping people improve their lives through specialty food products is Singer‚Äôs life purpose. ‚ÄúWhen I discovered that 75% of people suffering from IBS could find complete symptom-relief with a low FODMAP diet, I knew I had a responsibility to help,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúFody exists to help people live life to the fullest by participating in life‚Äôs greatest and simplest pleasures ‚Äì ¬†such as sharing a meal with friends.‚Äù The biggest challenge Singer has faced with Fody is getting retail buyers to move beyond their initial disbelief that a pasta sauce, marinade, ketchup without onion or garlic, or even a dairy-free Caesar salad dressing will actually taste great. ‚ÄúProducts like ours are counterintuitive to what many buyers are used to. We overcome that¬†when they try our products and realize we're on to something,‚Äù he says. To those looking to align their career with their life purpose, Singer says, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be afraid to enter uncharted territory. If there‚Äôs a need that‚Äôs not being met, it may mean that it‚Äôs just waiting for you to come along and blaze the trail.‚Äù Samantha Tannor is the founder of Tannor's Tea. Samantha Tannor Samantha Tannor, founder of Tannor‚Äôs Tea Tannor‚Äôs Tea creates sugar-free matcha concentrates. The company mission is to develop products that make you feel good from the inside out by focusing on pure, plant-based ingredients. Founder Samantha Tannor is an MBA student at Berkeley-Haas School of Business who comes from a background working in the food industry. She started Tannor‚Äôs Tea after traveling to Asia and discovering how popular matcha is there. She then found out that every single liquid matcha concentrate sold in the U.S. is loaded with sugar. So she decided to bring sugar-free versions to the market. As part of Berkeley's LAUNCH, a startup accelerator, she is selling Tannor‚Äôs Tea online on Amazon and in caf√©s around Berkeley. One hardship Tannor has faced is figuring out how to build a business without having any prior experience running a company. ‚ÄúI have questioned whether or not I possess the skills necessary to become an entrepreneur,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúIn order to combat these feelings of anxiety, I surround myself with a support system of family and friends who believe in me and genuinely wish for my success. Calling on these people has been my saving grace.‚Äù To others looking to align career and life purpose, Tannor recommends being honest with yourself. She says, ‚ÄúWhen people decide not to pursue their passions based on fear, they are doing themselves a disservice. Spend time focusing on what makes you feel inspired. By being honest with what you are truly passionate about, you will be closer to feeling fulfilled in your career.‚Äù David Sedeno is the founder of Pono Wines. Fernando Herzer David Sedeno, founder of Pono Wines David¬†Sedeno recently left a three-decade-long career in the California Fire Service to found Pono Wines, the first Napa boutique wine from a Native Hawaiian. Born and raised in Honolulu, Sedeno wanted to create a wine in order to offer people ‚Äúa taste of aloha‚Äù in every glass. Current vintages include the 2015 Mana Cabernet Sauvignon and Hapa Red Blend, and¬†the 2017 Hoku White. "In Hawaii, we are raised to 'live Pono' by making conscious decisions to do the right thing in terms of self, others, and the environment,‚Äù Sedeno explains.¬†‚ÄúMy family instilled this mindset in me, along with the idea that seeking Pono brings an appreciation for how life can be both simple and complex. I created Pono Wines not only to exemplify the richness that exists within this dichotomy¬†but to¬†also invite others to experience what it means to ‚Äòlive Pono.‚Äô‚Äù One hardship Sedeno faced when starting Pono Wines was self-doubt, as the wine industry was a complete change from his day job as a firefighter. To overcome this, he applied a lesson learned during his 35 years in the fire service: If your fundamentals are sound, things should work out in your favor ‚Äì as long as you don‚Äôt quit. To create Pono Wines, he wakes up every day ready to put in the hours, reach out to as many people as possible, and trust that their enjoyment of Pono will build the brand.
